title: Lemon Garlic Chicken Grain Bowl
directions: Season and pan-sear chicken thighs until golden and cooked through. Remove from pan.
In the same pan, saute 3 cloves minced garlic for 30 seconds.
Deglaze with 2-3 tbsp non-alcoholic Sauvignon Blanc (use half the amount of regular wine). Add a splash of chicken broth or water.
Simmer for a full minute to mellow the NA wine.
Add 1-1.5 tsp bottled lemon juice off heat at the very end.
Finish the sauce by swirling in 1.5 tbsp butter and seasoning with black pepper.
Toast rough-chopped walnuts dry in a separate pan for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.
Cook the multigrain rice/veggie blend on the stovetop. When done, fold in salt, a small knob of butter, and black pepper.
Fry an egg in butter on medium heat for 2-3 minutes until whites are set and yolk is runny. Season with salt and pepper.
Assemble the bowl: rice on the bottom, then veggies, then chicken with pan sauce spooned over, then walnuts, then fried egg on top.
Break the yolk over everything and serve immediately.
notes: Bowl assembly order matters: rice, veggies, chicken + sauce, walnuts, then egg on very top. Break the yolk so it runs through everything. Non-alcoholic wine is more acidic and sweeter than real wine, so use about half the amount. Bottled lemon juice is sharper than fresh -- start with less and add more to taste. Add lemon juice off heat to keep it tasting bright. If sauce seems thin, use about 1/4 cup total liquid and let it reduce to glossy. Add 1-2 tbsp hot water at the end if you want it saucier. Use walnuts over hazelnuts here -- hazelnuts are too sweet/dessert-leaning for this dish.
